entry.title: On the description of identifiable quartics
entry.summary: In this paper we study the identifiability of specific forms (symmetric tensors), with the target of extending recent methods for the case of $3$ variables to more general cases. In particular, we focus on forms of degree $4$ in $5$ variables. By means of tools coming from classical algebraic geometry, such as Hilbert function, liaison procedure and Serre's construction, we give a complete geometric description and criteria of identifiability for ranks $\geq 9$, filling the gap between rank $\leq 8$, covered by Kruskal's criterion, and $15$, the rank of a general quartic in $5$ variables. For the case $r=12$, we construct an effective algorithm that guarantees that a given decomposition is unique.
